Re ''As Cheerleaders Soar Higher, So Do the Risks,'' March 31: I am 16 years old and a former cheerleader. I have been a cheerleading coach for the past two years. I was glad to see the article because not many people understand how dangerous cheerleading is, and most people don't even consider it a sport.

Life-threatening accidents should never happen. The Sacramento City College team was trying a new stunt when an airborne cheerleader, or flier, fell to the floor after one of the boys responsible for catching her lost his balance.

Losing your balance is understandable, but there should have been more teammates there to protect her. Whenever our team tries a new maneuver, the cheerleaders form a ''safety circle'' around the stunt group; if someone fails to catch the flier, there are many more to catch her. The coach should have made sure that the safety of the cheerleaders came first.
